resources.name: **Natural History Museum of Utah**
resources.description: World-renowned museum with hands-on paleontology, dinosaur skeletons, fossils from the Cleveland-Lloyd Dinosaur Quarry, and interactive exhibits on Utah's ecology, native cultures, minerals, and more. Excellent for kids and families.
reviews: A museum that appeals to all ages. My kids keep running back to the dinosaur exhibits!
Stunning architecture and the interactive displays make learning fun.
Incredible fossil collection—our favorite museum in the city.
We love visiting every year as the kids grow; always something new to see.

resources.name: **Discovery Gateway Children’s Museum**
resources.description: Interactive, play-focused museum for children of all ages—features a water play area, construction zone, miniature town, climbing structure, science experiments, and more. Designed for families to explore and learn together.
reviews: My kids never want to leave! There are so many fun, educational things to try.
Great for toddlers and little kids, lots of sensory and pretend play areas.
A must for families with young children visiting Salt Lake.

resources.name: **The Leonardo**
resources.description: Innovative museum combining science, technology, and art to inspire creativity and curiosity. Interactive exhibits cover flight, robotics, the human body, art, and engineering. Popular for kids, teens, and adults.
reviews: The hands-on science exhibits were a huge hit with my son!
Unique blend of art and science—different from any other museum here.
Got my kids asking lots of questions (and wanting to come back).

resources.name: **Clark Planetarium**
resources.description: Explore the solar system and beyond with interactive astronomy exhibits, a star theater, IMAX films, and more. Free exhibit floor; tickets for dome shows. Best for science-curious families.
reviews: Free admission to the exhibits is awesome! My kids are fascinated by the space and weather galleries.
IMAX and dome theaters are top notch.
Great for school-age kids and space lovers.

resources.name: **Utah Museum of Fine Arts**
resources.description: Collection of 15,000+ artworks from around the world, spanning 5,000 years. Kid-friendly programs, art hunts, and family days throughout the year.
reviews: Wonderful variety of art and fun activities for kids.
My daughter loved the kids’ scavenger hunt.
Quiet, relaxing, and educational even for young children.

resources.name: **Utah Museum of Contemporary Art (UMOCA)**
resources.description: Rotating contemporary visual arts, art workshops, and interactive installations. Family art activities available.
reviews: Love seeing new, thought-provoking art every visit.
Not huge but great for an hour with curious kids.
Staff are friendly and great with children.

resources.name: **This Is The Place Heritage Park**
resources.description: Living history village with pioneer houses, train rides, farm animals, pony rides, gemstone panning, and interactive demonstrations—amazing for kids wanting hands-on history.
reviews: So much for the kids to do! Gem panning was a favorite.
Informative and fun for the whole family.
Younger children loved the animals and crafts.

resources.name: **Chase Home Museum of Utah Folk Arts**
resources.description: Free museum in Liberty Park showcasing Utah’s folk and ethnic arts, including music, dance, crafts, and traditions. Exhibits rotate and often include interactive family events.
reviews: Loved learning about Utah’s diverse backgrounds.
Small, quick visit—great as part of a park outing.
Staff are welcoming and love sharing stories.

resources.name: **Pioneer Memorial Museum**
resources.description: Historic artifacts, carriages, pioneer clothing, toys, and art—a glimpse of 1800s life, with plenty for kids to recognize and explore.
reviews: We loved seeing the pioneer wagons and toys.
Massive collection, fascinating even for young kids.
Free and really informative.

resources.name: **Land Cruiser Heritage Museum**
resources.description: Unique museum featuring vintage Toyota Land Cruisers and vehicles—lots of family-friendly events and plenty to see for car lovers.
reviews: Our family loved the collection—even the non-car lovers.
Hands down the best vehicle museum I’ve visited.
Great destination for a dad-and-kids trip.
